channel.title: Suggestions
channel.description: I have left, came back, multiple times for around three years now and I have not went into one certain language to learn throughout the whole time. It's not that I don't want to learn, because I do. I would appreciate everyone's opinion on THEIR favorite language they have learned/worked with before and the most decided by all of you, I will dedicate myself into learning to my full extent. I am now 16, and have been interested in programming since around 10. I really want to go to college and study in CS. This will help me in the long run, thanks in advance to this community.

item.title: Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:2, topic:541478”]You need to start straight away if you’re looking for a comp-sci related degree. I would advise you to pick whatever you like, just refrain from using ‘stupid’ languages. I would recommend you learn Java, this forum and rsps in general can help you a bit with that too.[/quote]Are you fucking kidding me…

Java is a great starting language. Simple to grasp, verbose structure (comparable to written English, if you will). Then I’d move onto Ruby because it’s fuckin’ gr8.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Adobe Adobe
item.description:
@Adobe wrote:

I’m just wondering, Does anyone know of a site similar to html.net towards java learners?
Thanks in advance.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Honestly though, programming is just a matter of learning the structures etc and then applying each individual lang’s syntax, give or take.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Tree:

Our first unit was on C. Then we moved on to Java to cover the oop side.

I like that. I’d kill to avoid C++! When you think about it: if you take out pointers, structs, unions and a few other keywords, Java’s basic procedural structure is identical to C.

I had a pure java module, I’m doing a mainly java, tad of C module now and I believe I shall be using scheme for my next programming module. I’m echoing what’s been said but first start of with a language like C/C#/Java but also dip into and be familiar with a few others. Stuff like lisp, ruby, python are all nice to play around as it’s a completely different style to the aforementioned languages.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Tree:

Our first unit was on C. Then we moved on to Java to cover the oop side.

Hmm, my first unit was Java which was also an introduction to professional programming practice. Next programming unit is C/C++.

Java would be my recommendation, that or C.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

Our first unit was on C. Then we moved on to Java to cover the oop side.

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestions
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

You need to start straight away if you’re looking for a comp-sci related degree. I would advise you to pick whatever you like, just refrain from using ‘stupid’ languages. I would recommend you learn Java, this forum and rsps in general can help you a bit with that too.

Read full topic
